subject: linear_algebra
title: Matrix Factorization for Recommendations
contentHtml:
Matrix factorization is a powerful technique in linear algebra that can be used to build recommendation systems.

In this context, we'll focus on Singular Value Decomposition (SVD) and Non-negative Matrix Factorization (NMF), two popular methods for collaborative filtering.
problemHtml:
Suppose we have a user-item interaction matrix \mathbf{R} with dimensions m × n, where m is the number of users and n is the number of items.

We want to factorize this matrix into two lower-dimensional matrices, \mathbf{P} and \mathbf{Q}, such that \mathbf{R} \approx \mathbf{P} \mathbf{Q}^T.
